description:
This canyon is described in limited detail in Canyons Near Sydney by Rick Jamieson. Help the Australian canyoning community by contributing track notes to ropewiki.com

A high quality canyon, despite its name. The best section is the final KM before the Dumbano junction with deep sculpted walls consistently 1-3m wide, the KM above that still worth visiting, and then more intermittent shallow sections in the 3rd KM above the junction.

Approach

Descent

Expect to find a number of long swims plus many log and boulder jams, some of which may require ropework to safely descend the downstream side. The canyon has been descended and ascended without ropework, but it's recommended to take a 20m rope for safety to aid with the log jams.

The Dumbano junction can be easy to miss, it comes in from behind-left while you're distracted / dealing with a couple of large boulders in the creek bed, passing them on the right.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

  • OzUltimate.com : Tom Brennan Trip Report
  • OzUltimate.com : Tom Brennan Photos
